Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for CDN usage, including expected traffic volume, geographic distribution, latency requirements, and content types to be delivered.
Evaluate and select the appropriate Azure CDN offering (Standard or Premium) based on performance, features, and cost.
Plan the CDN architecture, including endpoint configurations, caching rules, and integration with existing applications and services.
Create and configure CDN endpoints in the Azure portal, specifying the origin server and caching policies.
Set up custom domains for the CDN endpoint, including SSL/TLS certificates for secure delivery.
Enable security features such as HTTPS, DDoS protection, and access control policies to safeguard content delivery.
Define caching rules and expiration policies to optimize content delivery and reduce latency.
Conduct performance testing to ensure the CDN meets latency, availability, and throughput requirements.
Set up monitoring for CDN performance metrics such as cache hit ratio, latency, and traffic volume using Azure Monitor.
Periodically review and optimize CDN configurations based on usage patterns and performance data.
Create detailed documentation of the CDN setup, including architecture, configurations, and operational procedures.
Conduct training sessions for the operations team on managing and troubleshooting the CDN setup.
Ensure the CDN setup complies with regulatory requirements and implement regular auditing procedures.
